greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the length of the leftmost ascent (i.e., height of the first peak) in the n-th Dyck path encoded by A014486(n).
comment: In other words, this sequence gives the number of leading 1's in the terms of A063171.
example: A014486(20) = 228 (11100100 in binary), encodes the following Dyck path:
and the first rising (left-hand side) slope has length 3, thus a(20)=3.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 02 2007
